alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 11:56AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Volusia County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1156 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Port Orange, moving northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Port Orange, New Smyrna Beach, South Daytona, Daytona Beach Shores and Ponce Inlet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. On rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
